newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia should invest more in tourism - official.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia should invest more in tourism - official.

text.p: Slovenia needs to increase significantly spending on developing and promoting tourism in order to boost income from the sector, an industry official said on Thursday.

"By investing 25 million marks ($16.7 million) a year, tourism revenue could reach two billion dollars in five years," Franci Krizan, director of the Center for the Promotion of Tourism told a news conference.
The 1996 budget provided only 200 million tolars ($1.5 million) for tourist promotion, down from 360 million tolars the previous year.
Experts forecast tourism revenue of about $1.1 billion this year, unchanged from 1995.

In the first eight months of the year, the number of tourists in Slovenia rose four percent to 243,846. The number of foreign tourists was up by 12 percent, while the number of domestic tourists fell by three percent. -- Marja Novak, Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
